channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2023120116
item.description:
Report E-2023120116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose and the trailer became compromised. This allowed approximately 8 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023120107
item.description:
Report E-2023120107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: WILLIAMSPORT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT TERMINAL DRIVER DISCOVERED MATERIAL ON TOP OF CTMV. INVESTIGATION SHOWED DOME LID WAS NOT PROPERLY SEATED BY SHIPPER PERSONNEL. DRIVER OPENED LID AND RESEATED COVER ONTO GASKET THEN PROPERLY SECURED DOME COVER. RELEASED MATERIAL CLEANED BY DRIVER. NO ADDITIONAL INCIDENT WITH SHIPMENT.

item.title: Report E-2023120096
item.description:
Report E-2023120096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While staging freight into temporary transit storage rack forklift operator struck the top chime area of a drum already staged in the rack slightly puncturing it consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum after it was repaired with drum putty to prevent further leakage.
